Posts.Content: Unicorn128 wrote: I was in the hospital for 6 days after my surgery. I developed necrosis on the left side so I had 5 treatments in a hyperibaric chamber. I was diag with DCIS in August. I had just lost my mother in March due to Lung cancer. I saw her go through radiation and I just could not see me doing that.  I just started physical therapy for my arms and muscles. It has been very slow for me is this unusual. I know everyone is different. I get sad and scared. The DCIS was detected early which was good news. 2 weeks after my surgery on the 28th of Sept my daughter had to have surgery to have a ovary and fallopian tube removed it twisted and died off. She was in extreme pain. The 29th she turned 16, and missed her homecoming dance. She was a trooper. Poor husband and father to had to take care of us. It is almost December and I am not back to work yet and when will I know. I never thought I would join a chat room but I feel I can get some help emotionally and spiritually. This is a life changing event and I am trying to deal with this. I have a positive attiude but sometimes I just feel abandoned. Thanks for your thoughts and wishes. God Bless Dx 8/10/2007, DCIS, 1cm, Stage 0, Grade 1, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Bilateral on 09/14/2007 Unicorn128 Kathy_K

Posts.Content: Nov 26, 2007 10:00PM - edited Nov 26, 2007 10:01PM by Unicorn128 I had 2 drains the first one came out at 5 weeks and the 2nd was at 7 weeks. They were no fun at all. At one point I started calling it names. Lu
